alert.note: Alert for Benton; Buchanan; Cedar; Clinton; Delaware; Dubuque; Iowa; Jackson; Johnson; Jones; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 24 at 3:10AM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow expected with visibility reductions under one mile at times, especially in open or rural areas. Winds gusting as high as 35 to 40 mph producing wind chills of 20 below to near 30 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Iowa. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 6 AM CST early this morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 29 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
